Print status_reason in the log

In case the cluster could be deleted immediately after the creation
failure, there is no chance to see the reason for debugging purpose.

commit_message:
Do not perform the tenant stack limit check for admin user

Removing stack creation limit for admin since admin can view all stacks,
and stacks created by other tenants would have been counted in the limit
check.

Change-Id: Ie2e9251245e7e16309661154e17724e5984c21e6
Story: 2003487
Task: 24756
(cherry picked from commit 22b14ff975f885c26b861d4d1b22577cca189e04)

Commit a7661065743086961b8ef93056b810e7d2a49eda removed the
all-nodes-config.j2.yaml Heat template. This template had the support
for specifying hieradata to merge into the all_nodes hieradata via the

commit_message:
Restore AllNodesExtraMapData

Commit a7661065743086961b8ef93056b810e7d2a49eda removed the
all-nodes-config.j2.yaml Heat template. This template had the support
for specifying hieradata to merge into the all_nodes hieradata via the
AllNodesExtraMapData. This commit restores the parameter which is now
set as an Ansible variable which will be used by the tripleo-hieradata
role.

Change-Id: Ib3838d404b45ae6684ef7e0aa211cb8015271866

commit_message:
Use ansible vars nic config

Migrates the NetworkConfig resource to use ansible vars as the values
for Heat parameters for the IP and subnet cidr. This makes it so that
the nic config template value coming out of Heat is generic per role.
The same nic config can then be used for any node of that role type by
Ansible, and the Ansible vars will be resolved at config-download
runtime.

Change-Id: I7e85dabd42ccb348ea27825d03c08157222956a1

commit_message:
Add var for {{network.name_lower}}_cidr

Adds a group var for {{network.name_lower}}_cidr for each role. Using
the lowecase name will make it more consistent with the lowercase
network names for the IP addresses.

Also removes the {{network.name}}_cidr output from role.role.j2.yaml as
those values have already been included the group vars.

Change-Id: Ib660c2dd25e2207f51439ec6b9c59b6e88eb23f8

subject: Fix the pep8 test will raise "Unknown test found in profile: B109"
messages:
[{'account_id': 29062, 'date': '2019-07-27 08:44:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29062, 'date': '2019-07-27 08:51:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-07-29 12:40:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hello Cy Chiang. Thank you for your interest in contributing with the Swift community. I noticed you have a couple of patches against the stable/pike. Pike was released almost 2 years ago and there's been 3 (almost 4) releases since then, which means we are not looking to keep merging changes to it, unless it is a serious security bug. Please feel free to submit changes against master and we will be happy to review and welcome your contributions."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-07-29 18:55:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

Looks a whole lot like https://review.opendev.org/#/c/593048/ which was already backported to queens as https://review.opendev.org/#/c/598130/.

`tox -e pep8` is decidedly busted on stable/pike; I feel like we've got an interest in having it working in case some user-facing issue comes up that genuinely *should* have a backport this far back. As Thiago said, that would normally be limited to security vulnerabilities.

In general I agree that the advice for anyone trying to maintain stable/pike swift is and should be to upgrade to a more-recent release. But with the above concern (and considering how low-risk this change is; we don't even import oslo.config), I think I'm OK with approving it."}, {'account_id': 29062, 'date': '2019-07-30 00:41:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Looks a whole lot like https://review.opendev.org/#/c/593048/ which
 > was already backported to queens as https://review.opendev.org/#/c/598130/.
 > 
 > `tox -e pep8` is decidedly busted on stable/pike; I feel like we've
 > got an interest in having it working in case some user-facing issue
 > comes up that genuinely *should* have a backport this far back. As
 > Thiago said, that would normally be limited to security
 > vulnerabilities.
 > 
 > In general I agree that the advice for anyone trying to maintain
 > stable/pike swift is and should be to upgrade to a more-recent
 > release. But with the above concern (and considering how low-risk
 > this change is; we don't even import oslo.config), I think I'm OK
 > with approving it.

Hi Tim, Thank you advice.
So cloud I use the same bug id to update master bandit.yaml or need to open new bug to fix it?"}, {'account_id': 29062, 'date': '2019-07-30 00:44:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Hello Cy Chiang. Thank you for your interest in contributing with
 > the Swift community. I noticed you have a couple of patches against
 > the stable/pike. Pike was released almost 2 years ago and there's
 > been 3 (almost 4) releases since then, which means we are not
 > looking to keep merging changes to it, unless it is a serious
 > security bug. Please feel free to submit changes against master and
 > we will be happy to review and welcome your contributions.

Hi Thiago, Thanks!
Maybe I could test the doc in stable/rocky?"}]
revisions:

commit_message:
Fix the pep8 test will raise "Unknown test found in profile: B109"

According to the bandit current version document, the B109 plugin
has been removed. So the bandit.yaml needs to remove the B109 test.
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/commit/ with commit id
is d93eed549242013ca10f6fc990dd4234b69958f7.

Change-Id: Ib654bfb76a44484489a4622edb38acc43a0da672
Closes-Bug: #1838123

commit_message:
fix NetworkSegmentRange OVO entry point

The NetworkSegmentRange entry point in the setup.cfg references an
invalid package path to the corresponding OVO class. This patch fixes
the package name to reflect the proper path.

Change-Id: I228a159a9d3eca7021e3ba08d9ad40f9ff8329df
(cherry picked from commit 7c174e7bd09c159deab7cf3170e0bb959edaf74a)

commit_message:
Some python improvements in common/container-puppet.py

- Regroup the if/else container_cli
- Remove dcmd variable
- Use extend instead of push for --privileged

Change-Id: Iedcf73334b8c30867292f15cc942ab0fd6547afb

consistent with other actions of cluster.

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I1c658ddb1e4470dcf1f547747c9f90fdb08ad438
Story: #2005924
Task: #34225

commit_message:
Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate apache from usage of regular syslog files
to journald.

Change-Id: Ifde6b86bec87fdd2fa161f8d28aed7f6ffa52f74

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-22 08:39:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix gnocchi db population

Due to Ubuntu packaging, it chowns ceilometer_system_user_home to root
during some dependency package installation. Due to this ansible
is unable to become a ceilometer_system_user_name and complete
db population.
Since become as user is not required for population, we're ommiting it
for distro installs.

Change-Id: I6c68e7d0710ea3fa3c45fa3aa27b40c9e3ca6f71

commit_message:
Fix gnocchi db population

python3-gnocchiclient seems to be required for ceilometer to
correctly populate gnocchi db

Change-Id: I6c68e7d0710ea3fa3c45fa3aa27b40c9e3ca6f71

Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate service from usage of regular syslog files
to journald.

subject: update spec: virtual persistent memory
messages:
[{'account_id': 23598, 'date': '2019-07-10 02:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-07-10 08:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-29 22:26:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This change proposes a spec for the Train release, which is currently under spec freeze. If you still wish your spec to be considered for Train, you may restore it and follow the spec freeze exception process per [1]. Alternatively, you may propose your spec to the backlog per [2], or wait until the U release opens and propose it there.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/008060.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/readme.html#backlog-specifications'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-10 02:23:46.000000000', 'message': "update spec: virtual persistent memory

Update VirtualPMEM object to support pmem data migration,
otherwise we can't get pmem info from remote host. And
use 'label' instead of 'rc_name', because rc_name is
a little confusing, actually only the 'label' name will
be saved but not the resource class name.

Change-Id: I96472956ed6b0f75a0f299cfa5596ff9a8855a12
Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
"}]
commit_message:
update spec: virtual persistent memory

Update VirtualPMEM object to support pmem data migration,
otherwise we can't get pmem info from remote host. And
use 'label' instead of 'rc_name', because rc_name is
a little confusing, actually only the 'label' name will
be saved but not the resource class name.

Change-Id: I96472956ed6b0f75a0f299cfa5596ff9a8855a12
Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory

commit_message:
Trace receipt of update_device_* rpc messages in neutron-server

Generate an osprofiler trace_point every time neutron-server receives
an update_device_* rpc message with trace_info in its context. We assume
this marks the time when ovs-agent finished processing a port.

Change-Id: I554bc45ad44931691029e0066d5b8483522a7dd2
Partial-Bug: #1833674

subject: Allow overcommit of dedicated CPU
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1011, 'name': 'Tushar Patil', 'email': 'tushar.vitthal.patil@gmail.com', 'username': 'tpatil'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-09-05 08:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-23 21:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-23 22:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-23 22:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-23 22:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-23 22:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

the more  i thnk about this the less conviced i am that this is a good idea. without tantat aware pinning i think this is a non starter on security grounds even with my counter perposal for hw:cpu_policy=pinned.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-11-21 03:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(10 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-11-21 04:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-21 15:38:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-01-03 16:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Too complicated, IMHO. This is the kind of thing that I was afraid of. It blurs the distinction between what "dedicated" means to the point of making a description of what "a dedicated CPU" is virtually impossible.

Sorry, this just isn't something I support. You're talking about shaving nano to microseconds off a *tiny* percentage of system or I/O calls for some special VMs that have *some* tolerance for jitter but not as much tolerance for jitter as other workloads that can run on a pool of shared host physical CPUs. All to improve VM packing for these special VMs (not for performance-critical VMs, which must run on "real" dedicated host CPUs and not for non-performance-critical VMs which can run on the shared pool).

I just don't think this is something we should be modifying Nova to support, sorry Tushar :(

-jay'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-29 22:15:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This change is being abandoned because it proposes a spec against an old release. If the spec should still be considered, please restore the change and move the spec to the current release (please note that spec freeze is in effect for Train - see [1] for the exception process) or the backlog/ directory [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/008060.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/readme.html#backlog-specifications'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 08:01:37.000000000', 'message': 'Allow overcommit of dedicated CPU

Allow overcommit of dedicated CPU to take the advantage of low latency
over shared VCPUs thereby improving overall CPU utilization of the compute
host.

Change-Id: I1d77e2b7b603744a2f3afb66e8ee99c8bdcadc81
'}]
commit_message:
Allow overcommit of dedicated CPU

Allow overcommit of dedicated CPU to take the advantage of low latency
over shared VCPUs thereby improving overall CPU utilization of the compute
host.

Change-Id: I1d77e2b7b603744a2f3afb66e8ee99c8bdcadc81

subject: Add subtree filter for GET /resource_providers
messages:
[{'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-08-22 15:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-22 16:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

I suspect this is probably fine: it is a suitably generic operation that you're right, plenty of people would probably want to do.

However, if you wanted to be super complete you might express more strongly why GET /resource_provider?in_tree?myrp.root_provider_id and then traverse the resulting tree for "myrp" is a hardship. Is it because doing the work client side is expensive/slow? Is it because transferring the unused data is more problematic that simply "wasteful"?

Like I said, probably a reasonable thing to do, just trying to understand.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-08-24 13:24:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-08-24 13:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

@Chris: thanks for the feedback. I added some extra explanation to the problem statement about the reason neutron would like to use subtree instead of in_tree'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-08-27 06:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-28 21:58:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Stopped after Use Cases. Perhaps I'm missing something, but I'm not seeing this being necessary or even particularly useful. Please help me understand if I'm off base."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-08-29 11:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

Replied on the Use case questions inline.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-08-30 07:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-19 18:02:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

(2 comments)

It's interesting that you're advocating client-side processing in bp/placement-resource-provider-request-group-mapping-in-allocation-candidates [1] but are wanting to avoid it here badly enough to propose a new queryparam.

I don't remember discussing this bp at the PTG - did we? Was anything decided? I see it crossed out on L363 of the etherpad [2] but I don't know what that means.

Anyway, I was only opposed to this because I think it's unnecessary and we want to keep placement tight. But I'm willing to change my vote to "meh" and see what others think.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597601/
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-ptg-stein'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-27 13:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2018-08-22 15:55:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add subtree filter for GET /resource_providers

Querying resource providers belonging to a given RP subtree will be a necessary
operation as soon as nested resource providers will be widely used. The current
``in_tree`` query param can only be used to query RPs in a single tree. If the

commit_message:
Add subtree filter for GET /resource_providers

Querying resource providers belonging to a given RP subtree will be a necessary
operation as soon as nested resource providers will be widely used. The current
``in_tree`` query param can only be used to query RPs in a single tree. If the
client wants to filter for just a subtree then it has to do that filter on the
client side.

bp placement-subtree-filter-for-resource-providers

Change-Id: I04e16cc76e47423e0bf0b887d71fe80557ac69b2

Thanks for your thorough remarks and especially for the suggestions for improvement!'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-13 23:31:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(17 comments)

My main issue with this spec is that it is explicitly libvirt-specific. I'm not suggesting to split it into multiple specs, because putting the framework in place without any driver using it doesn't make sense. But I think the spec itself should make a clearer distinction between which pieces are specific to a particular virt driver and which are generic. One possible way to crystallize this would be to actually integrate the PowerVM driver's implementation details into this same spec. I would be happy to collaborate on that if you think it's a good idea."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-14 15:44:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-08-27 13:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-08-27 13:45:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Fixed the comments, but device attachment is still TODO.

Unfortunately I won't be in Denver. I could possibly contribute to the discussion remotely?"}, {'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-08-27 14:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-27 16:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-08-27 16:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(13 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-08-27 16:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

-1 because doing PFs without VFs seems wrong. Willing to be proven wrong myself though'}, {'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-08-27 17:05:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-27 18:43:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(14 comments)

It's really difficult to comment on this without the spec showing example YAML files for the types of common host setups an operator would be looking at.

Add to that, I think there's generally overuse of custom traits and the big problem is that there is no versioning scheme built into the YAML descriptor file, which makes evolution of this approach a non-starter.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-08-27 18:57:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I would have expected a lot of the stuff described here to be in scope for cyborg. Not that we should exclude all that from nova necessarily, but I think that it's probably worth calling out how this intersects (or not) cyborg's intended scope."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-27 19:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(7 comments)

So here are the major things I see as still needing to be addressed:

- Fill in the driver attach/detach section
- Address config file versioning
- Talk about how this intersects with cyborg
- At least think about how a custom trait evolves into a standard trait'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-08-28 05:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Want to add two more questions:
1. does it support setup and cleanup method for the device? since there are some device need setup before assignment, and cleanup after free.
2. does it support vendor specific driver? The different vendor may have different way setup/cleanup device.

Basically, it sounds like intersects with Cyborg, maybe it is same as your #3 question.'}, {'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-08-28 14:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(14 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-28 20:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Since the titles of these tend to be pretty important when going back to them on specs.o.o and other historical digging, I think the name ought to be changed. That's not really enough to be -1 about, but I'll go ahead and call it that to add my vote to some of the comment other people have made.

Also, the questions raised about migrating custom to standard traits are something we ought to think about in more depth (somewhere/when). I'm not sure there is a good way to do it because the entire point of "CUSTOM_" is that we do not know about it so we can't do things like say "in the db update custom_foo for standard_foo" or similar kind of forward moves in os-traits.

One thing I hope we've decided is that we (OpenStack projects) will never publish a CUSTOM_ trait or resource class in non-test code?'}, {'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-08-29 14:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-08-29 15:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-07 12:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I continue to think this title is misleading, see my comments on patchset 5.'}, {'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-09-07 12:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-09-07 12:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Forgive me, I omitted your comment. I think the new name is much more descriptive, thank you!'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-13 17:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

Discussion at PTG: need to add an "owning service" field.

Nova and Cyborg (and whoever) get to read the same file, and then manage whichever devices are tagged as being owned by them.'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-09-13 17:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-12 13:48:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(10 comments)

Yeah, so while I'm very supportive of the idea of using YAML to describe the provider, inventory and trait information for devices on a compute host, I'm not thrilled with this spec as written.

It's very difficult to review the spec because there's no JSONSchema document(s) that clearly describe the YAML file format (and the subsections). A tabular format listing potential attributes just isn't the same as a JSONSchema document. Alternately, I'd go for just an example YAML file with comments explaining the purpose of each field.

In addition, I believe we should separate the concept of reporting these pieces of information (from the virt driver to placement) from the discussion of the descriptor file.

This is why, frankly, I did a spec already that describes a provider descriptor file:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550244

And I left the discussion of how a virt driver would report these attributes to a separate spec.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-22 22:13:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(4 comments)

Depending how [1] goes, Konstantinos and/or I can edit this spec to just describe the nova side, i.e. how we're consuming the config file defined there.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612497/"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-11-02 10:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-05 15:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Is this dead and thus a potential for abandonment?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-29 22:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This change is being abandoned because it proposes a spec against an old release. If the spec should still be considered, please restore the change and move the spec to the current release (please note that spec freeze is in effect for Train - see [1] for the exception process) or the backlog/ directory [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/008060.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/readme.html#backlog-specifications'}]

commit_message:
Modelling passthrough devices for report to placement

This spec proposes a model for passthrough devices to report as nested
resource providers to Placement.

blueprint: device-placement-passthrough

Co-Authored-By: Konstantinos Samaras-Tsakiris <konstantinos.samaras-tsakiris@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I3be6a4e3d06939afa0ee33a65ebf5bd9367bd7f1

Unless I'm misunderstanding, this [1] is one of the canonical use cases for nested resource providers in placement, and the use of request groups, but that's not mentioned anywhere in here. Unless, of course, I'm missing something.

commit_message:
Scheduling support for SR-IOV bond

In NFV scenario, it is desirable to have redundant network connectivity
provided by multiple physical NICs. A basic setup is a VM with multiple
passthrough Virtual Funtions (VFs) that are backed by different
Physical Funtions (PFs).

Implements: blueprint sriov-bond
Change-Id: I52dfe87cf8cbffdeac559eac064ce41c13ce3fc1

commit_message:
Return "deleted" and "estimated_reclaim" time of instance for admin

In some case, admins want to know soft-deleted instance's delete
and estimated reclaim time by API.

APIImpact

Blueprint: add-deleted-time-attribute

See within for the main comment about lack of predictability. If it is more predictable than my comment thinks, then please make that more clear in the spec. Right now it sounds like it "might work, might not" which is not great.

There are some nits related to spelling, no big deal, just noticed them while reading.'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2018-09-21 11:18:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

hello folks, would it be more meaningful if the reasoning in this spec was not about possibly fixing guest hanging in some cases and performance, but https://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/compute/hypervisor-selection.html#security-considerations-for-memory-optimization ? commit_message:
Allow disabling KSM / mem-merge via extra spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/allow-disabling-ksm-via-extra-specs

KSM stands for Kernel same-page merging, relevant to linux and qemu.
It is usually enabled by default in qemu, but may cause issues with specific
workloads (for example freezing), so tenant admin should have an option
to disable it.

Change-Id: If90efe8df995fb7cf01acadd5020dd8c25e152b5

commit_message:
Support aggregate affinity filters/weighers

Adds support for affinity policies that examine aggregates instead of
service hosts when evaluating a server group constraint.

Change-Id: I5795a0173976c4fc476ed06ecd7f7ec4edf2792b
Blueprint: aggregate-affinity

'}, {'created': '2019-07-17 23:34:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multi-listener load balancers

Load balancers with multiple listeners, running on an amphora image
with HAProxy 1.8 or newer can experience excessive memory usage that
may lead to an ERROR provisioning_status.
This patch resolves this issue by consolidating the listeners into
a single haproxy process inside the amphora.

Story: 2005412
Task: 34744
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Idaccbcfa0126f1e26fbb3ad770c65c9266cfad5b

commit_message:
Fix multi-listener load balancers

Load balancers with multiple listeners, running on an amphora image
with HAProxy 1.8 or newer can experience excessive memory usage that
may lead to an ERROR provisioning_status.
This patch resolves this issue by consolidating the listeners into
a single haproxy process inside the amphora.

Story: 2005412
Task: 34744
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Idaccbcfa0126f1e26fbb3ad770c65c9266cfad5b

commit_message:
Make nova ephemeral storage backend configurable per-role

When multiple Compute roles are used, admins may want to use different storage
backends on each role.

This change turns NovaEnableRbdBackend into a role specific param.
Any other config that is implicitly enabled by the global NovaEnableRbdBackend
now requires a dedicated param.

Co-Authored-By: ratailor@redhat.com
Change-Id: I9f40a2a3561fcb1d1fec9d9c3c1f9cabaf02650c
Implements: blueprint nova-backend-per-role
(cherry picked from commit 65d7e55f549875636d314fff09707ca2650084a0)

commit_message:
ci: Fail when roles arent cloned by zuul

This patch will make sure that all roles are cloned by Zuul
and if there's any requirement installed that's from opendev
which we have to clone, break out to ensure that we rely on
Zuul to check-out roles.

Change-Id: I2a58ba10d453380a406ef0cb425ad6618a12a1c0

commit_message:
Remove deprecated Core/Ram/DiskFilter

These were deprecated during Stein [1] and can now be removed, lest they
cause hassle with the PCPU work. As noted in [1], the aggregate
equivalents of same are left untouched for now.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/596502/

Change-Id: I8a0d332877fbb9794700081e7954f2501b7e7c09
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix undercloud backup via tripleoclient

The move to containerized deployment introduced a regression that mistral
executor service does not have access to undercloud host any more because
it runs in container. This patch and it's dependencies are fixing this
issue by:

  - using remote connection during DB backup
  - using volume mounts during filesystem backup

For details see following patches.

Change-Id: I8726187da444b55832bc2741da66ab7240e7bc3e
Depends-On: Ia1fd60a13570a42f5243beb5bb0487c743e31d27
Depends-On: I67899db3c1f4197210bc362a8f944529a3a7b2b3
Closes-Bug: #1812960

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 14:18:51.000000000', 'message': "Include DB host IP address in tripleo.undercloud-config env

Moving undercloud deployment to container means that during execution
of undercloud backup mistral-executor cannot connect to MariaDB
via local socket and has to use remote connection instead.

For that we need to have information about undercloud IP available
as using 'localhost' does not work.

Change-Id: Ia1fd60a13570a42f5243beb5bb0487c743e31d27
Partial-Bug: #1812960
"}, {'created': '2019-02-28 15:26:37.000000000', 'message': "Enable mistral_executor to perform backups

Moving undercloud deployment to container means that during execution
of undercloud backup mistral-executor does not have required connections
and data available and so creates empty tarball currently. This patch is
one of many, which are supposed to fix this. On THT side we need to:

- Include DB host IP address in tripleo.undercloud-config env
  - we need to have this information about undercloud IP available
    as we cannot connect to local socket anymore and using 'localhost'
    does not work.

- Mount directories which are meant to be backed up
  - currently directories backing up directories local to mistral_executor
    are useless for undercloud backup

commit_message:
Enable mistral_executor to perform backups

Moving undercloud deployment to container means that during execution
of undercloud backup mistral-executor does not have required connections
and data available and so creates empty tarball currently. This patch is
one of many, which are supposed to fix this. On THT side we need to:

- Include DB host IP address in tripleo.undercloud-config env
  - we need to have this information about undercloud IP available
    as we cannot connect to local socket anymore and using 'localhost'
    does not work.

- Mount directories which are meant to be backed up
  - currently directories backing up directories local to mistral_executor
    are useless for undercloud backup

Change-Id: Ia1fd60a13570a42f5243beb5bb0487c743e31d27
Partial-Bug: #1812960

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/612751/ renamed volume.v2.backup
to volume.v2.volume_backup. volume.v3 backup commands refer
volume.v2.backup but they were not updated.

commit_message:
Fix module paths for volumev3 volume backup commands

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/612751/ renamed volume.v2.backup
to volume.v2.volume_backup. volume.v3 backup commands refer
volume.v2.backup but they were not updated.
This causes "volume backup xxx" commands
when OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION=3 is specified.

Change-Id: Ib897dd483a7963763016ee3f1e8e1c3cc81d0bb0
Story:o 2006284
Task: 35990

subject: Keystone cannot generate keystone.log file
messages:
[{'account_id': 22124, 'date': '2018-11-09 08:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:43:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:46:59.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+1 by Dmitriy Rabotjagov (noonedeadpunk) <noonedeadpunk@ya.ru>
'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It seems, that by default, keystone do not require log dir, as all log files are supposed to be placed in journalctl (as all services are configured via systemctl). So this cause linked bug only in case, when log_file is specified in keystone.conf explicitly (probably with override).'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:54:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd like to understand more about the context before merging this. I don't see a reason, we have valid logs already."}, {'account_id': 22124, 'date': '2018-11-20 17:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

which file can we view keystone log? when I run keystone-playbook, It generate /var/log/keystone as root user and group. So keystone cannot generate keystone.log file when It start'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2018-11-20 17:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What version of OSA you're running? On rocky (18.0.0) you may see keystone log via command "journalctl -f --unit keystone-wsgi-public" for sure. Any of my deployments do not have /var/log/keystone directory at all.'}, {'account_id': 22124, 'date': '2018-11-20 17:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/master/playbooks/os-keystone-install.yml#L63-L68
Thanks for comment. Does your mention mean that the code above should be deleted?'}, {'account_id': 22124, 'date': '2018-11-20 17:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And also see this code.
https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/master/playbooks/os-keystone-install.yml#L81-L86'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-25 15:45:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I suggest to discuss this at the next osa meeting.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-29 20:40:14.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

no longer relevant, we're using journald"}]

as root user & root group

Change-Id: I51becb727b060beadeb88121236443bf80a25d16
Closes-Bug: #1802466

commit_message:
Keystone cannot generate keystone.log file

keystone cannot generate keystone.log file when they start
because keystone playbook make /var/log/keystone directory
as root user & root group

Change-Id: I51becb727b060beadeb88121236443bf80a25d16
Closes-Bug: #1802466

(2 comments)

Thank you Mark. Few comments inline. You did not answer if new version of python-dracclient library is required for this change. Also please create a story for this and add release notes.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-01-31 07:59:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I looked at python-dracclient code and pending patches, I don't think any library change is needed. I highly suspect we will want to backport this as well, so we'll need a release note and appropriate story/task entered so we can perform the backport and appropriately track the change.  Aside from that, it looks good."}, {'account_id': 28370, 'date': '2019-01-31 15:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Sorry for the oversight.  You are correct, there is no change to the python-dracclient for this change to be effective.

Basically we are just taking advantage of the feature of the iDRAC that allows for batching of jobs into a single queue, with the reboot being part of that.  In doing so, we ensure that all the jobs are ready for execution when the reboot occurs.  This is all existing functionality.'}, {'account_id': 28370, 'date': '2019-02-07 21:12:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

(2 comments)

I was speaking with Rick Pioso, and I think there might be a better approach here.

Rather than further tying the power class to the setting of the BIOS configuration by having it know more about the jobs, I am going to take a look at changing the interface to the client.commit_pending_bios_changes to instruct it to wait until the job is in the correct state.

This will allow the existing power code to remain unchanged, and hide the details of job management from the power code.

Comments welcome on the new approach.  I will hopefully have a new patch uploaded early next week.'}, {'account_id': 28370, 'date': '2019-05-21 19:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2019-05-21 19:33:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build failed.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 21:43:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix potential race condition on node power on and reboot

Currently there is the possibility that a configuration job
does not transition to the correct state and start execution
during a power on or reboot operation.  If the boot device
is being changed, the system might complete its POST before
the job is ready, leaving the job in the queue, and the
system will boot from the wrong device.

This fix suggests the following change for the node object:

 o   Do not apply any pending configuration changes from node
        during power off.  Leave the state saved.
 o   On power on or reboot, submit a job queue that contains
        both the config job and a reboot job (reboot will also
        cause power on).  Do not power on the system directly,
        but let the reboot job do it instead.

This will ensure the iDRAC is in a state to execute the job
prior to the reboot starting, removing this race condition.

Change-Id: I5cc71fb3c9a7e0166aab5bd458bbd257cefa8f5b

 o   On power on or reboot, submit a job queue that contains

'}, {'created': '2019-05-21 19:03:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix potential race condition on node power on and reboot

Currently there is the possibility that a configuration job
does not transition to the correct state and start execution
during a power on or reboot operation.  If the boot device
is being changed, the system might complete its POST before
the job is ready, leaving the job in the queue, and the
system will boot from the wrong device.

This fix suggests the following change for the power control:

  o During internal call to set boot device, poll the iDRAC job
    queue for a configurable amount of time to ensure the job
    is in the correct state
  o Throw an exception on timeout if the job does not transition
    to the correct state
  o Proceed with normal logic as soon as the job is in the
    correct state

This will ensure the iDRAC is in a state to execute the job
prior to the reboot starting, removing this race condition.

Change-Id: I5cc71fb3c9a7e0166aab5bd458bbd257cefa8f5b

is being changed, the system might complete its POST before
the job is ready, leaving the job in the queue, and the
system will boot from the wrong device.

This fix suggests the following change for the power control:

  o During internal call to set boot device, poll the iDRAC job
    queue for a configurable amount of time to ensure the job
    is in the correct state
  o Throw an exception on timeout if the job does not transition
    to the correct state
  o Proceed with normal logic as soon as the job is in the
    correct state

This will ensure the iDRAC is in a state to execute the job
prior to the reboot starting, removing this race condition.

Story: #2004909
Task: #29259

Change-Id: I5cc71fb3c9a7e0166aab5bd458bbd257cefa8f5b

commit_message:
Fix potential race condition on node power on and reboot

Currently there is the possibility that a configuration job
does not transition to the correct state and start execution
during a power on or reboot operation.  If the boot device
is being changed, the system might complete its POST before
the job is ready, leaving the job in the queue, and the
system will boot from the wrong device.

This fix suggests the following change for the power control:

  o During internal call to set boot device, poll the iDRAC job
    queue for a configurable amount of time to ensure the job
    is in the correct state
  o Throw an exception on timeout if the job does not transition
    to the correct state
  o Proceed with normal logic as soon as the job is in the
    correct state

This will ensure the iDRAC is in a state to execute the job
prior to the reboot starting, removing this race condition.

Story: #2004909
Task: #29259

Change-Id: I5cc71fb3c9a7e0166aab5bd458bbd257cefa8f5b

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: Icee2189e5a56e06ae01c7e3eee585e4c7a9553a6

Fix bogus reference to conditional in octavia upgrade tasks

Adds a fact to take the value of the EnableInternalTLS heat parameter so
it can be used in ansible upgrade tasks.

Closes-Bug: #1836729

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-14 23:10:57.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Profile the nova CDM builder code

This is a mix of things mentioned in the mailing list [1].

The main thing is adding simple profiling (if debug is enabled)
of the nova CDM builder code which may not be very interesting in
a small setup (like a 2-node devstack) but could be more useful
in a larger deployment with several hundred compute nodes and
thousands of VMs. Ideally long-term osprofiler or something like
it would be used so this profiling data could be sent to a database
and visualized.

Lots of other things are noted inline with FIXMEs and TODOs as
opportunities for optimization which can be broken down into a
series of performance improvement related changes, some of which
depend on changes to python-novaclient.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006254.html

Change-Id: I669c36cbdb656231b8cef854132d920660146e2d
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Profile the nova CDM builder code

This is a mix of things mentioned in the mailing list [1].

The main thing is adding simple profiling (if debug is enabled)
of the nova CDM builder code which may not be very interesting in
a small setup (like a 2-node devstack) but could be more useful
in a larger deployment with several hundred compute nodes and
thousands of VMs. Ideally long-term osprofiler or something like
it would be used so this profiling data could be sent to a database
and visualized.

Lots of other things are noted inline with FIXMEs and TODOs as
opportunities for optimization which can be broken down into a
series of performance improvement related changes, some of which
depend on changes to python-novaclient.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006254.html

commit_message:
Mount /var/run rw

collectd creates and deletes /var/run/unixsock. Without this patch,
the socket can not be created.

Change-Id: I4dcff373bc5b94d448be39fd2829abc6e0510096
(cherry picked from commit dfa594a6ad9cd288ef22e694522bec5292cf89e3)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-07-23 22:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-07-29 17:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Voltage Metrics

This patch adds the support to transform the Voltage information
from the sensor data into metrics that can be used by Prometheus.

- IPMI parser updated
- Tests for voltage metrics

Change-Id: I6ffa8e091bc8822c6ab7ce01928d666c741a8ffd

commit_message:
Add CephGrafanaNetwork to the list of the services

As per documentation, one of the steps to have the
haproxy endpoint available is to define the service
network that will be consumed to build the endpoint
attributes.
To match these requirements and maintain compatibility
with the existing services, we're also moving the
grafana port to 3100.

Change-Id: Icaf7d998c9cf21b8f00d381cec70a88ea50b6659

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-22 07:03:50.000000000', 'message': "Always add NAT rule to a LR when updating a FIP

Before this patch, the NAT rule was attempted to be updated when a
FIP was reassigned to another port. However, this was a noop
since the NAT rule didn't exist anymore causing the reassigning to
be ineffective and to fail silently.

This patch is always adding the NAT rule to the Logical Router
no matter if the Neutron FIP is being added or updated.

The bug that this patch addresses was being hit in the gate with
around a 30% ratio because the maintenance task was fixing it while
tempest was still rying to SSH into it.

Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py

Change-Id: Icebf4a82f64989112c3ca810b4358de490108c2d
Closes-Bug: #1835029
Closes-Bug: #1833820
Co-Authored-By: Jakub Libosvar <jlibosva@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d662f444280f5dc0a304a0b4de4767c91304c747)
"}]
commit_message:
Always add NAT rule to a LR when updating a FIP

Before this patch, the NAT rule was attempted to be updated when a
FIP was reassigned to another port. However, this was a noop
since the NAT rule didn't exist anymore causing the reassigning to
be ineffective and to fail silently.

This patch is always adding the NAT rule to the Logical Router
no matter if the Neutron FIP is being added or updated.

The bug that this patch addresses was being hit in the gate with
around a 30% ratio because the maintenance task was fixing it while
tempest was still rying to SSH into it.

Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py

Change-Id: Icebf4a82f64989112c3ca810b4358de490108c2d
Closes-Bug: #1835029
Closes-Bug: #1833820
Co-Authored-By: Jakub Libosvar <jlibosva@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d662f444280f5dc0a304a0b4de4767c91304c747)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 23:27:18.000000000', 'message': "Disallow in-place update of Port MAC address

While Neutron may technically allow updating the requested MAC address
of a port (for admin users only), in practice this only appears to work
when the port is not in use. Use Heat's replace-on-update flow, which is
designed to handle resources that are in use, to deal with changes to
the requested MAC.

Change-Id: I278584ecfe59a338d3135416527d9d3332808d2a
Task: 31012

designed to handle resources that are in use, to deal with changes to

Change-Id: I278584ecfe59a338d3135416527d9d3332808d2a
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/665692
Task: 31012
"}]
commit_message:
Disallow in-place update of Port MAC address

While Neutron may technically allow updating the requested MAC address
of a port (for admin users only), in practice this only appears to work
when the port is not in use. Use Heat's replace-on-update flow, which is
designed to handle resources that are in use, to deal with changes to
the requested MAC.

Change-Id: I278584ecfe59a338d3135416527d9d3332808d2a
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/665692
Task: 31012

commit_message:
Don't require in-place MAC address update

Previously, we checked that when updating the MAC address that the port
was updated in-place. However, this only works because the port isn't
attached to anything. In a more realistic scenario, updating in-place
actually fails. Remove this check to allow changing the Heat code to
replace the port when the MAC changes.

Change-Id: Ie8dd18d77a98a345d9129e4e8cb1a027f4cfdf60
Task: 33766

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-29 14:48:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix Designate Zone lookup by name

Zones are a concept of the Designate v2 API. Since v1 is still the
default, we need to explicitly use v2 when doing anything to do with
Zones. We were doing this when looking up a zone directly, but not when
falling back to listing all zones and going through them by name. This
meant that designate.zone constraint validation would fail (including on
the 'zone' property of OS::Designate::RecordSet) when the zone was
specified by name rather than UUID.

Change-Id: Id4194a74398488813f901b255f312f7ac962a426
Task: #29162
(cherry picked from commit 8c79ae0aeb8f937f45d94f5f549de344d7ea5817)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Designate Zone lookup by name

Zones are a concept of the Designate v2 API. Since v1 is still the
default, we need to explicitly use v2 when doing anything to do with
Zones. We were doing this when looking up a zone directly, but not when
falling back to listing all zones and going through them by name. This
meant that designate.zone constraint validation would fail (including on
the 'zone' property of OS::Designate::RecordSet) when the zone was
specified by name rather than UUID.

Change-Id: Id4194a74398488813f901b255f312f7ac962a426
Task: #29162
(cherry picked from commit 8c79ae0aeb8f937f45d94f5f549de344d7ea5817)

Hey guys, do we have any problem for windows guest OS, if the machine type changed after a stop and start instance.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-07-29 08:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

> Hey guys, do we have any problem for windows guest OS, if the
 > machine type changed after a stop and start instance.

As I couldn't parse your question, I asked you to clarify your question on IRC.  Posting the summary of our discussion[1] here:

- It seems like you were _assuming_ this patch is changing the default machine type in 'Train' release -- no, we aren't; the default remains the same, 'pc'.  This patch is just fixing some bad assumptions for the getDomainCapabilities() call.

- Next, you had a question (unrelated to this patch) on IRC for Windows: if Windows license reactivation will be re-triggerred if you change the machine type?  The answer is, yes, it does.  Because changing machine type is similar to changing the motherboard.  And Windows documentation[2] confirms, too: "When installing Windows 10, the digital license associates itself with your device's hardware. If you make significant hardware changes on your device, such as replacing your motherboard, Windows will no longer find a license that matches your device, and youll need to reactivate Windows to get it up and running."

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2019-07-29.log.html#t2019-07-29T07:43:13
[2] https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/20530/windows-10-reactivating-after-hardware-change'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-07-29 08:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2

Thanks for Kashyap getting me out of this. The patch LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-07-29 14:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(2 comments)

This all looks very sane. We definitely need to work on our multi-arch testing but every little bit helps'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-10 21:01:03.000000000', 'message': 'DNM demonstrate that get_domain_capabilities is broken.

testing patch to show get_domain_capablites is broken
when you have an emulator installed that does not have
a defulat set in libvirt_utils.get_default_machine_type
and the emulator does not support q35

the qemu sparc emulator is an example of this.

currently get_domain_capabilities is not called on master
outside of unit test where the data is faked but if you
try to uses it explodes with a libvirt exception as the
q35 machine type is invalid for the sparc emulator amoung
several others.

Change-Id: Id86c6b23a32a66564c2e7c794104e3a553df947d
'}, {'created': '2019-07-10 23:17:05.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: harden get_domain_capabilities

This patch converts nova.virt.libvirt.host._get_domain_capabilities
to take all arguments as option kwargs which mathces the signiture
of the libvirt getDomainCapabilities fucntion.

This change refactors libvirt_utils.get_default_machine_type
to use a dictonary of defualt arch to machine_type mappings
and default i686 and x86_64 to 'pc'

This change extends get_domain_capabilities to register
domcaps by both the versioned name returned by libvirt
and the alias that was requested.

This change LibvirtConfigDomainCaps with machine_type and
machine_type_alias properties.

This change factors out the domain cap test data into a
seperate fake_libvirt_data module and adds valid
example for sever architectures such as armv7 i686 and
sparc.

This change adds more test cases to validate the changes
above.
Partial-Implements: blueprint image-metadata-prefiltering
Partial-Implements: blueprint amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Id86c6b23a32a66564c2e7c794104e3a553df947d
"}, {'created': '2019-07-15 12:59:44.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: harden get_domain_capabilities

This patch converts nova.virt.libvirt.host._get_domain_capabilities
to take all arguments as option kwargs which mathces the signiture
of the libvirt getDomainCapabilities fucntion.

This change refactors libvirt_utils.get_default_machine_type
to use a dictonary of defualt arch to machine_type mappings
and default i686 and x86_64 to 'pc'

This change extends get_domain_capabilities to register
domcaps by both the versioned name returned by libvirt
and the alias that was requested.

example for sever architectures such as armv7 i686 and

"}, {'created': '2019-07-23 21:35:17.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: harden Host.get_domain_capabilities()

Previously get_domain_capabilities() in nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host
assumed that 'q35' would be an acceptable fallback default for any
architecture if no default machine type was hardcoded in nova for that
architecture.  This was incorrect on two levels:

  1. q35 is specific to x86 architectures.
  2. Even on x86 architectures, nova's current default is 'pc'.
     (There is an initiative to update it to q35, but that has
     not landed yet.)

Furthermore, we need to be able to cope with situations where nova
has no default machine type hardcoded, by relying on the default
returned from calling libvirt's getDomainCapabilities() API with
no machine type specified.[0]

So this commit makes the following changes:

- Convert nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host._get_domain_capabilities() to
  take all arguments as optional kwargs which match the signature of
  libvirt's getDomainCapabilities() function, allowing it to be called
  with unspecified machine type.

- Refactor libvirt_utils.get_default_machine_type() to use a dictionary
  of default arch to machine_type mappings, and default i686 and
  x86_64 to 'pc'.

- Extend get_domain_capabilities() to register domcaps by both the
  versioned name returned by libvirt (e.g. 'pc-i440fx-2.11') and the
  alias that was requested (e.g. 'pc').

- Extend the LibvirtConfigDomainCaps class with machine_type and
  machine_type_alias properties.

- Factor out the domain cap test data into a separate
  fake_libvirt_data module, and add valid examples for several
  architectures such as armv7, i686 and sparc.  These will all be
  included in the return value from Host.get_domain_capabilities()
  since the list of architectures for which to call the API come from
  fakelibvirt's getCapabilities() which already returns multiple guest
  architectures.

- Add more test cases to validate the changes above.

[0] To work around a bug in older versions of the libvirt-python API,
    it is necessary to explicitly pass None as the machine type
    parameter:

      https://www.mail-archive.com/libvir-list@redhat.com/msg182746.html
      https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt-python/commit/5004b4ad532ffa93ed4b62c8021eaa9210855209

Co-Authored-By: Adam Spiers <aspiers@suse.com>
Related-Blueprint: blueprint image-metadata-prefiltering
Related-Blueprint: blueprint amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Id86c6b23a32a66564c2e7c794104e3a553df947d

commit_message:
libvirt: harden Host.get_domain_capabilities()

Previously get_domain_capabilities() in nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host
assumed that 'q35' would be an acceptable fallback default for any
architecture if no default machine type was hardcoded in nova for that
architecture.  This was incorrect on two levels:

  1. q35 is specific to x86 architectures.
  2. Even on x86 architectures, nova's current default is 'pc'.
     (There is an initiative to update it to q35, but that has
     not landed yet.)

Furthermore, we need to be able to cope with situations where nova
has no default machine type hardcoded, by relying on the default
returned from calling libvirt's getDomainCapabilities() API with
no machine type specified.[0]

So this commit makes the following changes:

- Convert nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host._get_domain_capabilities() to
  take all arguments as optional kwargs which match the signature of
  libvirt's getDomainCapabilities() function, allowing it to be called
  with unspecified machine type.

- Refactor libvirt_utils.get_default_machine_type() to use a dictionary
  of default arch to machine_type mappings, and default i686 and
  x86_64 to 'pc'.

- Extend get_domain_capabilities() to register domcaps by both the
  versioned name returned by libvirt (e.g. 'pc-i440fx-2.11') and the
  alias that was requested (e.g. 'pc').

- Extend the LibvirtConfigDomainCaps class with machine_type and
  machine_type_alias properties.

- Factor out the domain cap test data into a separate
  fake_libvirt_data module, and add valid examples for several
  architectures such as armv7, i686 and sparc.  These will all be
  included in the return value from Host.get_domain_capabilities()
  since the list of architectures for which to call the API come from
  fakelibvirt's getCapabilities() which already returns multiple guest
  architectures.

- Add more test cases to validate the changes above.

[0] To work around a bug in older versions of the libvirt-python API,
    it is necessary to explicitly pass None as the machine type
    parameter:

      https://www.mail-archive.com/libvir-list@redhat.com/msg182746.html
      https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt-python/commit/5004b4ad532ffa93ed4b62c8021eaa9210855209

Co-Authored-By: Adam Spiers <aspiers@suse.com>
Related-Blueprint: blueprint image-metadata-prefiltering
Related-Blueprint: blueprint amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Id86c6b23a32a66564c2e7c794104e3a553df947d

commit_message:
Add ovs-plugins, hugepages and uptime to collectd

These plugins should be loaded by default, ovs-stats and ovs-events
should only get loaded, when ovs is used.

Also update the list of available plugins.

Change-Id: I40351932781a722dbf321c1efff981e786470c8c

commit_message:
Add extra_vars parameter to run_ansible_playbook function

This patch adds a new parameter called 'extra_vars (Defaults to None) to
the 'run_ansible_playbook' function. This parameter will set additional
variables to the 'ansible-playbook' command. It will accept either a
dict or the absolute path of a file (YAML or JSON format).

Change-Id: Ib25ee9593528ad680b14ca09c62addbbd0b773a3
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 35952145a1d5c5880ee3f66059fa00ec2156c8c2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-27 16:43:37.000000000', 'message': "Correct jinja loop logic for role_networks

The `_role_networks` variable in network loops was being defined and then
potentially redefined in a larger loop. If this option is first populated
with a None type and then later discovers a hash the deployment will fail
with a stack trace:

    'None' has no attribute 'append'

A full traceback from the error can be seen here[0]. To reolsve this
issue the empty array, `_role_networks` has been moved into the
`role.networks` case statement which will ensure the option is type safe
for every round.

[0] - https://pasted.tech/pastes/edba7903977c841901c0e655850d4f8b08b32e6c.raw

Closes-Bug: #1831885
Change-Id: I480786ed4d6b0a5544535ce232ae8206d04299b1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8833c2da2dcd7c78282d0d5494bb6280f03dd115)
"}]
commit_message:
Correct jinja loop logic for role_networks

The `_role_networks` variable in network loops was being defined and then
potentially redefined in a larger loop. If this option is first populated
with a None type and then later discovers a hash the deployment will fail
with a stack trace:

    'None' has no attribute 'append'

A full traceback from the error can be seen here[0]. To reolsve this
issue the empty array, `_role_networks` has been moved into the
`role.networks` case statement which will ensure the option is type safe
for every round.

[0] - https://pasted.tech/pastes/edba7903977c841901c0e655850d4f8b08b32e6c.raw

Closes-Bug: #1831885
Change-Id: I480786ed4d6b0a5544535ce232ae8206d04299b1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8833c2da2dcd7c78282d0d5494bb6280f03dd115)

commit_message:
Properly close web request

Currently this is throwing warnings about unclosed connections. We need
to properly close the response when we try to connect to the container
registries.

Change-Id: Ib93a0edb2e789855aa9e5908130a03ffcd9439c2
Closes-Bug: #1837393
Co-Authored-By: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 55c0d3652440df339b3caa1b9e87a6379a497571)

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I178bbe6dd1d38cebf0db229fe93d68b1faab6773

This is a combination of 2 commits to pass the check and gate jobs.

1. Add bindep.txt for Octavia

Some base packages are no longer automatically included in zuul
job runs. This is good as we need to call out our platform package
requirements.
This patch adds a bindep.txt to Octavia to capture those
package requirements.

(cherry picked from commit d9c459a8686817bdaf4967ffb45b2c180a5e4265)

2. "Resolve" bandit issue with sha1 hashes

We only use them as a consistent hash, not for anything security
related. Even if someone could manage a hash collision or something,
the worst that could happen is their own LB stops working...
So, just tell bandit to ignore them.
Added a docstring to one function to attempt to be extra clear.

Conflicts:
      octavia/common/tls_utils/cert_parser.py
Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to not having patch
I039ed0b40df8b72a1238f8896548fe77086c530c on stable pike.

Change-Id: I48e82f39e3980d6d50e3b710326b8e437eddb08b
'}]
commit_message:
Add bindep.txt and ignore sha1 warning

This is a combination of 2 commits to pass the check and gate jobs.

1. Add bindep.txt for Octavia

Some base packages are no longer automatically included in zuul
job runs. This is good as we need to call out our platform package
requirements.
This patch adds a bindep.txt to Octavia to capture those
package requirements.

(cherry picked from commit d9c459a8686817bdaf4967ffb45b2c180a5e4265)

2. "Resolve" bandit issue with sha1 hashes

We only use them as a consistent hash, not for anything security
related. Even if someone could manage a hash collision or something,
the worst that could happen is their own LB stops working...
So, just tell bandit to ignore them.
Added a docstring to one function to attempt to be extra clear.

Conflicts:
      octavia/common/tls_utils/cert_parser.py
Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to not having patch
I039ed0b40df8b72a1238f8896548fe77086c530c on stable pike.

(cherry picked from commit 91fae05a7d53362f5484154fc35c921f3482bc2f)
(cherry picked from commit 12bf4409faabfd4437d4f09a06cd216b24064ee7)

Change-Id: I48e82f39e3980d6d50e3b710326b8e437eddb08b

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt and upper-constrain neutron

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In test jobs the script tools/test-setup.sh is called which requires
mysql and postgres servers and clients to be installed.

Neutron also has to be constrained to the Rocky versions. This fixes
networking-bgpvpn-dsvm-functional test job: newer versions of neutron
uses constants that are not present the Queens version of neutron-lib.

To pass requirement checks sphinx has to be adjusted to global
requirements.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

Change-Id: I6b7afd3f6d0b45337f87e13352ab1095d51a23a3
(cherry picked from commit 4655630adc4ce3b6c69d3deffb397c36d67fab04)
(cherry picked from commit 29a07f7691072c7082fa53aea15a9d93f2f13344)

Remove modindex

We do not build the modindex, so let's not link to it - and produce a
broken link.

also, remove demo boilerplate.

Change-Id: Ia91dac139702d0b45de711a86ea9b5fa6aaf4659

commit_message:
Bulk delete of stored delayed calls

Instead of making a lot of single requests for deleting stored delayed
calls, we can use bulk requests.

Change-Id: Ia2a6462d72f31df18a9811329672eae7f60d160f

subject: disable triggering version discovery in test_generator unit tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-22 22:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-23 14:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-23 19:01:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-24 15:01:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

In OpenStack any bug usually has to be fixed in master branch first, and if the problem exists on stable branches then backport the fix branch-by-branch. (See process description: [1])
In case the bug does not exist in master anymore, then please indicate that in commit message.

Anyway, the 'command not found' errors in the Zuul checks that cause the failures will disappear, whenever the bindep fix [2] lands on stable/rocky.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#processes
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672543/"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-24 21:00:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> In OpenStack any bug usually has to be fixed in master branch
 > first, and if the problem exists on stable branches then backport
 > the fix branch-by-branch. (See process description: [1])
 > In case the bug does not exist in master anymore, then please
 > indicate that in commit message.
 > 
 > Anyway, the 'command not found' errors in the Zuul checks that
 > cause the failures will disappear, whenever the bindep fix [2]
 > lands on stable/rocky.
 > 
 > [1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#processes
 > [2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672543/

Thanks for the review! Yes, the bug is only applicable to the stable/rocky branch and with the latest openstacksdk 0.7.3 release.

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671384/

The current problem is fixed in stable/stein release by this patch.

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/614211/

Prior to the above patch, we used to create the senlinclient.v1.client.Client object via __init__, which causes keystoneauth1 to perform version discovery if clustering_default_microversion is set. Please see the bug report for more details.

I'll update the commit message to indicate that the fix is for stable/rocky only."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-24 21:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-25 07:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks for the clarification, Guang Yee!

Also, feel free to squash the bindep fix [1] to this patch as I think that both this patch and the bindep fix are necessary to pass Zuul checks.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672543/'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-25 17:42:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Thanks for the clarification, Guang Yee!
 > 
 > Also, feel free to squash the bindep fix [1] to this patch as I
 > think that both this patch and the bindep fix are necessary to pass
 > Zuul checks.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672543/

Thanks! I'll cherry-pick the changes from 672543."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-25 17:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-25 23:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-07-29 05:06:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM. Please also make a backport for the corresponding release note.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-29 15:43:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> LGTM. Please also make a backport for the corresponding release
 > note.

Thanks! I am unclear about your request. Is there a separate branch for the release notes? Please advice.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-22 22:18:41.000000000', 'message': 'disable triggering version discovery in test_generator unit tests

Fixed unit.actions.openstack.test_generator.GeneratorTest.test_generator
failure by avoid triggering version discovery as it needs to talk to
Keystone server. Talking to a live Keystone server is not needed for
this particular unit test.

Change-Id: Ib2c72e89612c9b2b4bccd37cb797804ea40e0b1f
Closes-Bug: 1837468
'}, {'created': '2019-07-23 14:49:50.000000000', 'message': 'disable triggering version discovery in test_generator unit tests

Fixed unit.actions.openstack.test_generator.GeneratorTest.test_generator
failure by avoid triggering version discovery as it needs to talk to

commit_message:
disable triggering version discovery in test_generator unit tests

Fixed unit.actions.openstack.test_generator.GeneratorTest.test_generator
failure by avoid triggering version discovery as it needs to talk to
Keystone server. Talking to a live Keystone server is not needed for
this particular unit test.

NOTE: this patch is only applicable to stable/rocky and with the latest
openstacksdk 0.17.3 release.

NOTE: this patch also includes change I9ab552dd4bf3826f358d73a4bddaf1885b1be130
from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672543/ as both are needed in order
to pass Jenkins.

Change-Id: Ib2c72e89612c9b2b4bccd37cb797804ea40e0b1f
Closes-Bug: 1837468

[{'created': '2019-07-25 00:13:44.000000000', 'message': "Correct jinja loop logic for role_networks

The `_role_networks` variable in network loops was being defined and then
potentially redefined in a larger loop. If this option is first populated
with a None type and then later discovers a hash the deployment will fail
with a stack trace:

    'None' has no attribute 'append'

A full traceback from the error can be seen here[0]. To reolsve this issue
the empty array, `_role_networks` has been moved into the `role.networks`
case statement which will ensure that the option is type safe for every
rount.

[0] - https://pasted.tech/pastes/edba7903977c841901c0e655850d4f8b08b32e6c.raw

Closes-Bug: #1831885
Change-Id: I480786ed4d6b0a5544535ce232ae8206d04299b1

commit_message:
Correct jinja loop logic for role_networks

The `_role_networks` variable in network loops was being defined and then
potentially redefined in a larger loop. If this option is first populated
with a None type and then later discovers a hash the deployment will fail
with a stack trace:

    'None' has no attribute 'append'

A full traceback from the error can be seen here[0]. To reolsve this
issue the empty array, `_role_networks` has been moved into the
`role.networks` case statement which will ensure the option is type safe
for every round.

[0] - https://pasted.tech/pastes/edba7903977c841901c0e655850d4f8b08b32e6c.raw

Closes-Bug: #1831885
Change-Id: I480786ed4d6b0a5544535ce232ae8206d04299b1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create Containers SIG

There is a willingness to share practices for containers, and a
need to document things, like previous attempt at collaborations.
We should create a SIG for ensuring this very specific use case
of dealing with OpenStack in application containers.

Change-Id: I1912b0038a99a8766ca34d562a202ed41772d103

commit_message:
Cinder support multiple Ceph volume backends

Wrap code making the assumption there is only one Ceph backend
(using is_ceph_volume_configured) in a "range" and use
ceph_backend_list helper to iterate all available Ceph backends.

Move Ceph pool application name in values.yaml from
conf.software.rbd.rbd_pool_app_name* to conf.ceph.pools.*.app_name

Change-Id: If1126e51fe9ebb85185e375dc282e83db63d934c
Depends-On: Iaa67061b05a9d355228ad7d3f5ee0f4f04dbdc66
Signed-off-by: Daniel Badea <daniel.badea@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Allow to delete multiple objects with advanced filters

This commit adds a possibility to delete db objects with
advanced filters, like 'in', 'eq', 'has' and so on.

Change-Id: I97bd3a5627f62081a2cb9487cc91920c5a11561b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 06:53:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix Designate Zone lookup by name

Zones are a concept of the Designate v2 API. Since v1 is still the
default, we need to explicitly use v2 when doing anything to do with
Zones. We were doing this when looking up a zone directly, but not when
falling back to listing all zones and going through them by name. This
meant that designate.zone constraint validation would fail (including on
the 'zone' property of OS::Designate::RecordSet) when the zone was
specified by name rather than UUID.

Change-Id: Id4194a74398488813f901b255f312f7ac962a426
Task: #29162
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Designate Zone lookup by name

Zones are a concept of the Designate v2 API. Since v1 is still the
default, we need to explicitly use v2 when doing anything to do with
Zones. We were doing this when looking up a zone directly, but not when
falling back to listing all zones and going through them by name. This
meant that designate.zone constraint validation would fail (including on
the 'zone' property of OS::Designate::RecordSet) when the zone was
specified by name rather than UUID.

Change-Id: Id4194a74398488813f901b255f312f7ac962a426
Task: #29162

[{'created': '2019-07-08 13:53:38.000000000', 'message': 'CI should auto-generate server_certs_key_passphrase

Bug 1833942 showed that in a case that the generated value
server_certs_key_passphrase is invalid, Octavia will fail to operate.

In CI, we currently provide a pre-defined passphrase that might cover
for potential breakages in the future. This patch removes the
pre-defined passphrase so it will get generated on each run.

Note that, TripleO will now[1] either auto-generate a valid passphrase
or validate a pre-defined one.

Related-Bug: #1833942

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:OctaviaServerCertsKeyPassphrase-32chars

commit_message:
CI should auto-generate server_certs_key_passphrase

Bug 1833942 showed that in a case that the generated value
server_certs_key_passphrase is invalid, Octavia will fail to operate.

In CI, we currently provide a pre-defined passphrase that might cover
for potential breakages in the future. This patch removes the
pre-defined passphrase so it will get generated on each run.

Note that, TripleO will now[1] either auto-generate a valid passphrase
or validate a pre-defined one.

Related-Bug: #1833942

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:OctaviaServerCertsKeyPassphrase-32chars

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669653/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669657/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669667/

Change-Id: Ie596b04614c2ca9d961694f4012c1553a092aa3e
(cherry picked from commit 1f3088c4aa2612a772e023f14fafc72c61c6cb07)

commit_message:
Unit field missing in snmp data

metrics as result it is throwing Missing field unit
in the log files. Added unit as tick from looking
at the telemetry-measurements doc upstream.

Story: #2006287
Task: #35996
Change-Id: Id50bf64e2a69f7d5152040a6784b914dadf8d8d6

commit_message:
Release cloudkitty 10.0.0 and python-cloudkittyclient 3.0.0

This marks the release of CloudKitty 10.0.0. This version includes the first
v2 API endpoints, which are completely supported by python-cloudkittyclient
3.0.0.

CloudKitty's release model has been switched back to
"cycle-with-intermediary". The goal is to make at least two releases per cycle
(at least one in addition the final one) in order to make v2 API features
available quicker.

Change-Id: I81c00ed711bef592d9bb1354b945756dded96f50
