[{'account_id': 24797, 'date': '2018-12-14 00:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-14 00:30:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 8726, 'date': '2018-12-14 00:51:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-14 00:30:04.000000000', 'message': 'Enforce router admin state before distributed

Enforce that a user updates the admin state of a router before modifying
the distributed state. The API currently allows setting admin state to
false concurrently with changing the distributed state.
This is fine for a transition of centralized->distributed, but the
distributed->centralized transition could leave other nodes configured
as distributed until an audit is performed.

Change-Id: Ie624aeb3f3aeb4db176d2ca0b22020208d4b408a
Signed-off-by: Matt Welch <matt.welch@intel.com>

commit_message:
Enforce router admin state before distributed

Enforce that a user updates the admin state of a router before modifying
the distributed state. The API currently allows setting admin state to
false concurrently with changing the distributed state.
This is fine for a transition of centralized->distributed, but the
distributed->centralized transition could leave other nodes configured
as distributed until an audit is performed.

Commit adds shim api extension which should be replaced by neutron-lib
shim extension once https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634509/ is merged.
New method 'is_admin_state_down_necessary' checks that shim extension
is loaded.

Set extension as standard by adding to _supported_extension_aliases in
neutron/services/l3_router/l3_router_plugin.py

Closes-Bug: #1811166
Co-Authored-By: Allain Legacy <allain.legacy@windriver.com>
Co-Authored-By: Enyinna Ochulor <enyinna.ochulor@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ie624aeb3f3aeb4db176d2ca0b22020208d4b408a
Signed-off-by: Matt Welch <matt.welch@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-25 00:01:00.000000000', 'message': 'py3: fix non-ascii metadata handling in account-server

Previously, we were storing the WSGI-style UTF-8-bytes-decoded-as-Latin-1
strings in the JSON field, and sending them back to eventlet directly.
If running in a mixed py2/py3 cluster, replication would eventually get
that back to the py2 server, and worse, the native-string version would
get back to the py3 server! Then on GET or HEAD, eventlet would barf
if any characters were outside the Latin-1 range.

Change-Id: I31d942e72fd7bfbb1db4dbb1dd522dff69969e5d
'}, {'created': '2019-07-25 21:18:10.000000000', 'message': 'py3: fix non-ascii metadata handling in account-server

Previously, we were storing the WSGI-style UTF-8-bytes-decoded-as-Latin-1
strings in the JSON field, and sending them back to eventlet directly.
If running in a mixed py2/py3 cluster, replication would eventually get
that back to the py2 server, and worse, the native-string version would
get back to the py3 server! Then on GET or HEAD, eventlet would barf
if any characters were outside the Latin-1 range.

Closes-Bug: #1837805
Change-Id: I31d942e72fd7bfbb1db4dbb1dd522dff69969e5d
'}]
commit_message:
py3: fix non-ascii metadata handling in account-server

Previously, we were storing the WSGI-style UTF-8-bytes-decoded-as-Latin-1
strings in the JSON field, and sending them back to eventlet directly.
If running in a mixed py2/py3 cluster, replication would eventually get
that back to the py2 server, and worse, the native-string version would
get back to the py3 server! Then on GET or HEAD, eventlet would barf
if any characters were outside the Latin-1 range.

Closes-Bug: #1837805
Change-Id: I31d942e72fd7bfbb1db4dbb1dd522dff69969e5d

messages:
[{'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-07-24 05:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-07-24 14:09:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

recheck

Thanks for the fix. Evidently we don't have unit test coverage of this. :-("}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-07-25 01:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Ben, I may need some help on using tooz, when I am playing tooz with small script for verification, it works fine, but when I embed it in the ironic inspector, there are various issues that seems to be related with the heartbeat and lease update.

For example, start coordinator with start_heart=True never succeed, and observed obvious delay during startup:

2019-07-25 09:25:04.774 9613 WARNING tooz.coordination [-] Retrying tooz.drivers.etcd3.Etcd3Driver.heartbeat in 1.0 seconds as it raised .

If I don use the start_heart=True, while using a greenlet to do the heartbeat, it's also not working, mostly saying "requested lease not found", or connection timed out.

It seems tooz or underlying libraries it used may not work with the service base on oslo.service, or maybe there is something I don't know. Is there any caveat that needs attention? Any pointers would help, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-07-26 12:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Hi Ben, I may need some help on using tooz, when I am playing tooz
 > with small script for verification, it works fine, but when I embed
 > it in the ironic inspector, there are various issues that seems to
 > be related with the heartbeat and lease update.
 > 
 > For example, start coordinator with start_heart=True never succeed,
 > and observed obvious delay during startup:
 > 
 > 2019-07-25 09:25:04.774 9613 WARNING tooz.coordination [-] Retrying
 > tooz.drivers.etcd3.Etcd3Driver.heartbeat in 1.0 seconds as it
 > raised .
 > 
 > If I don use the start_heart=True, while using a greenlet to do the
 > heartbeat, it's also not working, mostly saying "requested lease
 > not found", or connection timed out.
 > 
 > It seems tooz or underlying libraries it used may not work with the
 > service base on oslo.service, or maybe there is something I don't
 > know. Is there any caveat that needs attention? Any pointers would
 > help, thanks!

Hey

thanks for your fix!

Interesting thanks for the heads-up, can you share more info about the environment (apache, mod_wsgi, openstack version, etc...)?

We also facing some issues with greenlet and nova-api under apache so maybe it can be a similar issue between greenlet and apache...:
- https://review.opendev.org/663074
- https://review.opendev.org/668862
- https://review.opendev.org/671321

For further info you can read my blog story about this:
- https://herve.beraud.io/openstack/nova/oslo.messaging/rabbitmq/driver/2019/07/15/how-nova-consume-oslo-messaging.html
- https://herve.beraud.io/openstack/tripleo/gerrit/patch/heat-template/2019/07/23/how-to-patch-openstack-tripleo.html
- https://herve.beraud.io/openstack/tripleo/gerrit/patch/heat-template/2019/07/24/how-to-check-openstack-apache-mpm-engine-switching-fix-amqp-heartbeat-eventlet.html

I'm not sure if it's related to something similar than oslo.messaging but some piece of your puzzle looks like similar...'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-07-27 01:59:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you Herv for the kindly reply :)

 > Interesting thanks for the heads-up, can you share more info about
 > the environment (apache, mod_wsgi, openstack version, etc...)?

I am debugging ironic-inspector with source of master, apache is not used.

 > We also facing some issues with greenlet and nova-api under apache
 > so maybe it can be a similar issue between greenlet and apache...:
 > - https://review.opendev.org/663074
 > - https://review.opendev.org/668862
 > - https://review.opendev.org/671321
 > 
 > For further info you can read my blog story about this:
 > - https://herve.beraud.io/openstack/nova/oslo.messaging/rabbitmq/driver/2019/07/15/how-nova-consume-oslo-messaging.html
 > - https://herve.beraud.io/openstack/tripleo/gerrit/patch/heat-template/2019/07/23/how-to-patch-openstack-tripleo.html
 > - https://herve.beraud.io/openstack/tripleo/gerrit/patch/heat-template/2019/07/24/how-to-check-openstack-apache-mpm-engine-switching-fix-amqp-heartbeat-eventlet.html
 > 
 > I'm not sure if it's related to something similar than
 > oslo.messaging but some piece of your puzzle looks like similar...

Thanks for the reference, at first time I thought it may be related with concurrency, but after I successfully adopted memcached up and running with tooz, I guess the issue  maybe lie in underlying libraries. etcd3 has an unresolved issue [1] about the lease, but I am not sure whether it's the same issue I encountered, will keep digging.

[1] https://github.com/kragniz/python-etcd3/issues/560"}]

commit_message:
Fix wrong log level during heartbeat

It appears that tooz used log.warning which is a method
instead of an integer required by tenacity.

Change-Id: I0dd40f578ff0fc7bd1cd64c7889de2148ae6b06c
Closes-Bug: #1837693

commit_message:
Add the ability to configure ovn-remote-probe-interval

This parameter sets inactive probe interval of the JSON
session from ovn-controller to the OVN SB database.
By default this it is 5s which not be sufficient in
loaded systems or during high control-plane activity spikes,
leading to unnecessary reconnections to OVSDB server.
Now it is extended by default to 1 min and it
is configurable.

Change-Id: If8684927b17fc9f7ee4cca277b8b0ca9c4d8b5e1
Partial-Bug: #1836604

commit_message:
Build different etcd client depending protocol

etcd should not looking for TLS certificates when http protocol
is used.

> Build failed (gate pipeline).  For information on how to proceed,
 > see 
 > http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing
 > 
 > 
 > - tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates
 > http://logs.openstack.org/15/672415/1/gate/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates/fc96ecd/
 > : FAILURE in 1h 42m 02s 
 
The job fails as redis is not in the enabled_service list, therefore
we don't get redis_vip set, which is correct behavior from this patch,
but we have the fallback controller_virtual_ip:
 
Error:
2019-07-25 23:02:48 |         "puppet-user: Error: Function lookup() did not find a value for the name 'redis_vip'",
 
puppet-tripleo:
   $redis_vip = hiera('redis_vip', $controller_virtual_ip)
 
But controller_virtual_ip is set from [1]:
"controller_virtual_ip": "192.168.24.28",
...
"tripleo::haproxy::controller_virtual_ip": "192.168.24.28",


Submitted https://review.opendev.org/672940 to "Only assign redis_vip and redis_bind_opts if enabled" 



 
 
Note: also wondering at the moment why we have control_virtual_ip (seems
to be only used by ::tripleo::keepalived) and controller_virtual_ip.

 
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/15/672415/1/gate/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates/fc96ecd/logs/subnode-2/etc/puppet/hieradata/vip_data.json.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-07-26 12:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Build failed (gate pipeline).  For information on how to proceed,
 > > see
 > > http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing
 > >
 > >
 > > - tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates
 > > http://logs.openstack.org/15/672415/1/gate/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates/fc96ecd/
 > > : FAILURE in 1h 42m 02s
 > 
 > The job fails as redis is not in the enabled_service list,
 > therefore
 > we don't get redis_vip set, which is correct behavior from this
 > patch,
 > but we have the fallback controller_virtual_ip:
 > 
 > Error:
 > 2019-07-25 23:02:48 |         "puppet-user: Error: Function
 > lookup() did not find a value for the name 'redis_vip'",
 > 
 > puppet-tripleo:
 > $redis_vip = hiera('redis_vip', $controller_virtual_ip)

I was looking at the wrong haproxy class in puppet-tripleo :(

Manifests/profile/pacemaker/haproxy.pp|haproxy_bundle.pp is where we fail [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/profile/pacemaker/haproxy.pp#L124

commit_message:
Move redis_vip to all_nodes.j2

In case of cell stacks we need to pass redis_vip as an input
to be able to use redis on the central controllers. This
moves the redis_vip setting to all_nodes and only set it if
it is not an additional cell.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/672940

Change-Id: I7ca94dff4acf0816708110b9fe6f78d19dcc7b4d

commit_message:
Only assign redis_vip and redis_bind_opts if enabled

https://review.opendev.org/672415 only sets redis_vip
when service is enabled. Lets also move the redis_vip
and redis_bind_opts to the redis enabled section and
create haproxy_and_redis_vip only if redis is enabled.

Change-Id: I4f575772d80bcfd12019a81dd27d83aa952ddef6

commit_message:
Move default policy target

Move default target from context.can() into policy.authorize() so
it is easier to unit test the context behaviour.

This was not done originally due to this meaning placement avoided the
strange default target, but that is no longer required.

Change-Id: I23c433dcd459e7f930ac2eb8a3583c857836cae2

commit_message:
Use reference of irrelevant-files

This makes projects.yaml use reference of irrelevant-files for
removing duplicated irrelevant-files patterns for easy maintenance.

Change-Id: Ic78e201baec71f2ee6135d66940c877de24af5bf

i.e. http://logs.openstack.org/86/663386/3/check/ec2-api-functional-neutron/e8307ae/logs/testr_results.html.gz'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-07 10:05:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > up super hard, so I definitely don't think this is ready to go.
 > i.e. http://logs.openstack.org/86/663386/3/check/ec2-api-functional-neutron/e8307ae/logs/testr_results.html.gz

That's unrelated. Look at the previous patch in that series which has the exact same failures.

http://logs.openstack.org/54/663654/2/check/ec2-api-functional-neutron/9909733/logs/testr_results.html.gz

There are no references to the functions I removed in the previous patch and with those removed there are zero references to the objects I'm removing here. Given this is the case, how could this have any impact on the ec2-api project?

Note that I've already tried to fix the unit tests. Fixing the ec2 project's Tempest tests is not work I want to do nor work I feel I should have to do, simply so I can merge essentially unrelated cleanup patches like this. You don't have to review this but at least drop the -2 so others can as there does not appear to be a technical reason for it."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-07 10:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Note that I've already tried to fix the unit tests. Fixing the ec2 project's Tempest tests is not work I want to do nor work I feel I should have to do, simply so I can merge essentially unrelated cleanup patches like this. You don't have to review this but at least drop the -2 so others can as there does not appear to be a technical reason for it.

I agree that fixing another project's tempest tests isn't your responsibility, but it's my responsibility to make sure you're not breaking something, and the best way to do that is via the integration job on the project that depends on the ec2api stuff in nova. I do think the onus is on you to make sure you're not breaking something though regardless of how much you think it's unused - if there is a way to verify, it should be verified.

Given https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663386/ is passing now I'll drop my -2."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2019-07-26 18:21:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-26 18:24:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-31 16:03:29.000000000', 'message': "ec2: Remove unused functions from 'ec2utils'

Remove a large number of util functions from the aforementioned modules.
These were identified by searching for matches to functions bottom up,
removing those with new matches, then repeating until no matches were
found. Most of what's left is used by the metadata API and could be
moved there in the future.

An exception that is no longer used is removed. There are some unused
objects also, but these will be removed in a follow-up as their removal
is significantly more involved.

Change-Id: I852648a975745d0327378ffc30f1469a7ce82ca7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-06-05 17:17:39.000000000', 'message': "ec2: Remove unused functions from 'ec2utils'

Change-Id: I852648a975745d0327378ffc30f1469a7ce82ca7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
ec2: Remove unused functions from 'ec2utils'

Remove a large number of util functions from the aforementioned modules.
These were identified by searching for matches to functions bottom up,
removing those with new matches, then repeating until no matches were
found. Most of what's left is used by the metadata API and could be
moved there in the future.

An exception that is no longer used is removed. There are some unused
objects also, but these will be removed in a follow-up as their removal
is significantly more involved.

Change-Id: I852648a975745d0327378ffc30f1469a7ce82ca7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

improve the guideline more after some try and error.

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: I6988ed388cc6543bc49e62172aa93f34fdca8e95

commit_message:
Fix for utils LB DM transformation function

Fixing utils function for common LB data model transformation
to provider driver data model which does not consider
a Vip data model object.
Unit test which didn't cover this bug was modified.

Change-Id: Ib3d5eb1f27ec1f10ed0f73b342927b78f1a237c7
Implements Story: 2003733
(cherry picked from commit a9b99d2b41173a112f8bed6ae08ea845daa29f37)

commit_message:
Fix the load balancer service clients

The load balancer service clients were not using the base
service_client_config from tempest, so they would not pick up some
base settings, such as ca_certs, disable_ssl_certificate_validation,
etc.
This patch corrects that so that the clients will get the base
settings from tempest.

Change-Id: Ic7fa0d2e32cb8ff86fe013064e1ce53d4cf0d62e
Story: 2005880
Task: 33698

commit_message:
Remove support for Cisco N1KV

Cisco N1KV has announced EOL & EOS. So we are removing its support in
TripleO.

Change-Id: Icd56f6cba30ea2a0377ccbc9e830cd981a00e478

commit_message:
Adds "unset" action to the listener command

This patch adds "openstack loadbalancer listener unset" action to the
octavia client. This allows the user to unset the name, description,
etc. setings.

This is a patch in a chain adding "unset" to all of the octavia
commands. A follow on patch will include the release note.

Change-Id: I153967b69a1766cf1fa5033bc77d580d05aaceac

commit_message:
Adds "unset" action to the loadbalancer command

This patch adds "openstack loadbalancer unset" action to the octavia
client. This allows the user to unset the name, description, and/or
vip-qos-policy-id setings.

This is the first patch in a chain adding "unset" to all of the octavia
commands. A follow on patch will include the release note.

Change-Id: I7eac594b0e7f66fba2a571c152ede470ca61d530

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

commit_message:
Privsepify ipv4 forwarding enablement.

Follows the usual pattern, but with some nice cleanups to unit test
code as we get closer to the end of this journey.

Change-Id: Ie10b2f171842d19e55fbad3d751660e11bfce2cb

commit_message:
Remove no longer required "inner" methods.

Previously we were testing by using methods without decorators,
which were labelled as "inner" methods. We don't need to do that
now that we can fixture away the decorator.

Change-Id: I9b21e8a0f9a0ed9e70d1fc07e60a6beff110c19c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-29 08:09:44.000000000', 'message': "WIP Improve the CellDatabases test fixture and usage

In our unit and functional test environments, we are using the
CellDatabases test fixture to have multiple 'main' databases for both
single cell (cell0 database and cell1 database) and multi-cell tests.
The CellDatabases fixture is configured to use one of its databases as
a 'default' database to access when a RequestContext has not been
targeted to a cell.

Currently, it's configured to use the 'cell1' database as a default.
This configuration hides bugs because untargeted reads will find data
in the compute cell database when such a query would not succeed in a
real deployment. Many of the bugs we've seen have involved untargeted
reads (we have been generally good about targeting writes when needed).

This changes the configuration to use the 'cell0' database as a default
to catch bugs where writes/reads don't match. Some extra work was
needed to handle cases where nova-compute is first starting up and
using a generic get_admin_context() to access the database. Other cases
where nova-compute accesses the database should be handled by the RPC
CheatingSerializer which propagates a targeted RequestContext from the
caller to the callee.

Change-Id: I8181dd17d84296ec3477440caea5a9a18af4c97e

commit_message:
Improve the CellDatabases test fixture and usage

In our unit and functional test environments, we are using the
CellDatabases test fixture to have multiple 'main' databases for both
single cell (cell0 database and cell1 database) and multi-cell tests.
The CellDatabases fixture is configured to use one of its databases as
a 'default' database to access when a RequestContext has not been
targeted to a cell.

Currently, it's configured to use the 'cell1' database as a default.
This configuration hides bugs because untargeted reads will find data
in the compute cell database when such a query would not succeed in a
real deployment. Many of the bugs we've seen have involved untargeted
reads (we have been generally good about targeting writes when needed).

This changes the configuration to use the 'cell0' database as a default
to catch bugs where writes/reads don't match. Some extra work was
needed to handle cases where nova-compute is first starting up and
using a generic get_admin_context() to access the database. Other cases
where nova-compute accesses the database should be handled by the RPC
CheatingSerializer which propagates a targeted RequestContext from the
caller to the callee.

Change-Id: I8181dd17d84296ec3477440caea5a9a18af4c97e

- The backporting should happen branch-by-branch but stable/queens is missing. If the problem exists in older branches (like queens and pike) then please do the backport to queens first, then pike.'}, {'account_id': 8478, 'date': '2019-07-11 08:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-14 17:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-14 17:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-06-15 00:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/665434/1 : FAILURE in 2h 21m 28s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-16 16:32:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2019-06-17 08:40:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This change currently makes a large portion of the XenAPI unit tests to fail.
This shows that the code is very wrong, but it is used - there should have been some refactoring done to move some of this test code to os-xenapi.
The fake session here is used for all test cases, which include calls from the os_xenapi package.
host.call_plugin is called from there.

The right fix is to have a fake session here, with the fake session extended by os_xenapi to include this host.call_plugin and all of the other methods that are used (e.g. all of the _plugin_* methods that are currently in fake.py)'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2019-06-17 09:12:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So thinking more, I think that fake.py should be moved entirely to os_xenapi (removing the use of NovaException, so we don't have a cycling dependency), and then change stubs.py to import the fake from os_xenapi instead"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-26 20:57:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I think that fake.py should be moved entirely to os_xenapi

I'm afraid that by having kept this open I may have given the impression that I was at some point going to attempt to update it to do that, but I wouldn't know how."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-26 20:57:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Change-Id: I5916f431533b17a3f322cdc628f1b4bfc96b2873

commit_message:
Functional recreate for revert_resize

Attempting to recreate the noted bug in order to validate the fix at
[1]. The test passes, so either that fix isn't necessary or it's for a
different code path. In any case I think this adds test coverage we
didn't have, so it could be worth keeping.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665138/

Change-Id: If5c87824330bd851bf0ac9670738ae98658e8009
Related-Bug: #1498126

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-05 17:39:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Story: #2005924
Task: #34225

commit_message:
Add segments client

Segments client is necessary to test the routed provider networks
feature.
the following client methods are now available for Tempest:
* create_segment
* update_segment
* show_segment
* delete_segment
* list_segments

Change-Id: Ie89468351fc9cf68ccf356d35ee9ba4b5037c499

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-24 22:17:25.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "last context manager" from CellDatabases fixture

Long ago, when the CellDatabases test fixture was introduced, it
contained a mechanism/assumption to target the last targeted database
for untargeted (local) database accesses, when possible. It was a hack
for handling untargeted local database accesses in nova-compute with
the logic being, if nova-api targeted the cell2 database, it is likely
that the next untargeted database access will be by nova-compute as
part of the same request, thus the same cell database can be assumed.

However, since then, we've had improvements to the CellDatabases
fixture [1][2] which make the old hack unnecessary. As one of the
to-be-removed code comments states, the presence of this hack can hide
some (not all, because of "default context manager") bugs where we are
not targeting a request context to a cell when we should be targeting
it.

I came across the bug hiding problem again while trying to func test a
patch for making 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows' multi-cell
aware. Because of the "last context manager" hack, the func test
erroneously passes on a buggy patchset that is not properly targeting a
get_engine() call. This is because the "last context manager" causes
cell databases to be targeted by the test fixture code when they were
not targeted by the implementation code.

This removes the "last context manager" altogether and fixes a couple
of buggy tests that were hiding along with it, so that they pass. The
locking mechanism is also entirely removed because we are no longer
changing global state in the fixture.

Related-Bug: #1719487

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/6a0f091d9afc83e7bd94b0515108ac3a664367b0
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/6a06fd28c285786767c0af93149c32aa61846ff9

Change-Id: I406ed89d4fa072e3c1a9cf29668a58f2d360b780
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "last context manager" from CellDatabases fixture

Long ago, when the CellDatabases test fixture was introduced, it
contained a mechanism/assumption to target the last targeted database
for untargeted (local) database accesses, when possible. It was a hack
for handling untargeted local database accesses in nova-compute with
the logic being, if nova-api targeted the cell2 database, it is likely
that the next untargeted database access will be by nova-compute as
part of the same request, thus the same cell database can be assumed.

However, since then, we've had improvements to the CellDatabases
fixture [1][2] which make the old hack unnecessary. As one of the
to-be-removed code comments states, the presence of this hack can hide
some (not all, because of "default context manager") bugs where we are
not targeting a request context to a cell when we should be targeting
it.

I came across the bug hiding problem again while trying to func test a
patch for making 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows' multi-cell
aware. Because of the "last context manager" hack, the func test
erroneously passes on a buggy patchset that is not properly targeting a
get_engine() call. This is because the "last context manager" causes
cell databases to be targeted by the test fixture code when they were
not targeted by the implementation code.

This removes the "last context manager" altogether and fixes a couple
of buggy tests that were hiding along with it, so that they pass. The
locking mechanism is also entirely removed because we are no longer
changing global state in the fixture.

Related-Bug: #1719487

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/6a0f091d9afc83e7bd94b0515108ac3a664367b0
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/6a06fd28c285786767c0af93149c32aa61846ff9

Change-Id: I406ed89d4fa072e3c1a9cf29668a58f2d360b780

cinder::type provider executes osc commands, so this is only done once

commit_message:
Configure cinder's default volume type

Add a resource that creates Cinder's default volume type. The
cinder::type provider executes osc commands, so this is only done once
on the bootstrap node, and at step 4 when the cinder_api service is
running.

Partial-Bug: #1782217
Change-Id: Ia23996abefdd1410fb86f04ed84a314f4364339c
(cherry picked from commit 5e87dffbeed15756c55c397fb5962c551822336f)

commit_message:
Fix writing of keys without values

Sometimes there might be a key in configfile, that should be empty but
defined correctly. This patch fixes such behaviour and adds testing.

Change-Id: I693bc3a2aade7015d0465583001962df4ba53443

commit_message:
Freeze etcd3gw version to 0.2.3

To avoid issues, etcd3gw needs to be frozen to version
0.2.3.

Version 0.2.4 breaks Qinling during the lock acquisition.

Change-Id: I6738732f3576dba3e3cebb05d9b0026d1aca53a0
Story: 2006067
Task: 34784

to this job.

commit_message:
[stable/queens-only][ci] Enable LVM job

The LVM job in the check queue was set to non-voting
and the gate job was disabled due to bug 1833696 in
DevStack. It's now been fixed [1]. So revert changes
to this job.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669872/
Closes-Bug: #1833696

Change-Id: I3ce5cbee3ab82804871d7363eea53f319d96fce1

commit_message:
Remove [signing] config

Since pki-setup was removed in pike.This
patch removes the config options that were
left for backward compatibility, as PKI is
not supported.

Partial-Bug: #1829453
Change-Id: I83cd08e57fbc046ad69bd42eb2e5fa1ace6e8a28

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: Ie28caca2519b6e5940bb884876113b84d45c3048

commit_message:
Minor tox molecule fixes

* Molecule call in tox required minimal tox 3.8 due to {tty}
* Sorted dependencies
* Bump molecule dependencies to latest (improve repor readability)

Change-Id: I8c7c84f9a1ce11d314f81babd74e3caab729947c
Closes-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1833754

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/670196/10 : FAILURE in 2h 50m 48s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-23 22:53:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

One semi-unfortunate thing with this change is we don't have a dedicated log for the post test hook script run like devstack-gate would do. I'm sure we could probably redirect the script output to some log file and collect that in the post-task for collecting logs, but it's kind of unnecessary at this point IMO since the output does go into the console log and can be found in the ARA report as well:

http://logs.openstack.org/96/670196/10/check/nova-next/a00cba8/ara-report/result/7f3b4380-8826-4def-accc-34135eafc789/"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-07-25 11:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

Neat!'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-25 17:17:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

This appears to be a sane port, in that all the pieces from the old thing appear in the new thing. I don't feel like I can +2, but I'll proxy one from someone with more zuul savvy."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-07-26 15:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

We can see the post test hook running here properly:

http://logs.openstack.org/96/670196/10/check/nova-next/a00cba8/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-07-23_19_17_39_245517

Also see the novnc proxy running with TLS support properly:

http://logs.openstack.org/96/670196/10/check/nova-next/a00cba8/controller/logs/screen-n-novnc-cell1.txt.gz#_Jul_23_18_28_02_820060

And comparing an old nova-next run:

http://logs.openstack.org/40/672840/3/check/nova-next/081d5ac/logs/testr_results.html.gz

to the new one:

http://logs.openstack.org/96/670196/10/check/nova-next/a00cba8/testr_results.html.gz

we see the same tests being run (sans one called "devstack" from the old run -- I assume that's something to do with the legacy jobs).

LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-26 18:09:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

test_results is just tempest tests recorded in stestr. The post_test_hook doesn't have anything to do with those, it's just a place to run random tests in a devstack environment after tempest runs."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-07-26 18:14:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> test_results is just tempest tests recorded in stestr. The
 > post_test_hook doesn't have anything to do with those, it's just a
 > place to run random tests in a devstack environment after tempest
 > runs.

I know. I was just using it to show the tempest test regexes looked to be producing the same tests run for the old legacy job vs the new v3 job."}]

commit_message:
Convert nova-next to a zuul v3 job

For the most part this should be a pretty straight-forward
port of the run.yaml. The most complicated thing is executing
the post_test_hook.sh script. For that, a new post-run playbook
and role are added.

The relative path to devstack scripts in post_test_hook.sh itself
had to drop the 'new' directory since we are no longer executing
the script through devstack-gate anymore the 'new' path does not
exist.

Change-Id: Ie3dc90862c895a8bd9bff4511a16254945f45478

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-26 10:32:20.000000000', 'message': 'doc: Fix broken links

There's invalid RST for links in some doc files.

You cannot write:
.. _unscoped token: :doc:`../admin/tokens`

This gets linked to as
"https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest//contributor/:doc:%60../admin/tokens%60"

Fix all occurences that I found.

Change-Id: I8556bd9e1cbe661fe54fa6361e93f6041cdc9272
'}]
commit_message:
doc: Fix broken links

There's invalid RST for links in some doc files.

You cannot write:
.. _unscoped token: :doc:`../admin/tokens`

This gets linked to as
"https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest//contributor/:doc:%60../admin/tokens%60"

Fix all occurences that I found.

Change-Id: I8556bd9e1cbe661fe54fa6361e93f6041cdc9272

commit_message:
Add healthcheck script for Nova metadata

This patch adds script for docker health check of Nova metadata API
service. The script checks API service using curl.

Existing script healthcheck/nova-metadata is also removed as this
script is linked in nova_metadata_footer template block. This block
does not exist (anymore?) and we have to have metadata check as part
of nova-api check, because those two services share container image.

Change-Id: I597efc57f9c564409b566c598d9d2467bb31d8cd
(cherry picked from commit 1760afaaccf748f2aac06ebe2cf0eb38c107ad77)

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: I59ae41adc16f3a05f29fcca1b1ba18b75be4df10

[{'created': '2018-10-22 10:58:53.000000000', 'message': "Add health checks for Swift services

This patch is adding health checks for background processes. The check
is performed by comparing recon cache file modification. This is far
from ideal, because recon files are shared via services of same type.
But it's the only way to at least partialy check correct behaviour
for background processes. In future there we should add timestamp info
to each recon file for all services using the recon file. Then we would
be able to find out if all background services are updating their caches
in timely fashion and stay within the border of containers.

commit_message:
Add health checks for Swift services

This patch is adding health checks for background processes. The check
is performed by comparing recon cache file modification. This is far
from ideal, because recon files are shared via services of same type.
But it's the only way to at least partialy check correct behaviour
for background processes. In future there we should add timestamp info
to each recon file for all services using the recon file. Then we would
be able to find out if all background services are updating their caches
in timely fashion and stay within the border of containers.

Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib6fad8311b5a728914ce9df9122194c5f7036be7
(cherry picked from commit 575fde1a963d3941e7dbc5a457bc05faf7e9b75f)
